intro: Melandrium californicum, commonly known as the California catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Melandrium californicum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
